intro: Austrostipa koordana, commonly known as the Koord's wiregrass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern South America. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers, typical of many grass species. Austrostipa koordana is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native range.
